text:
January 17, 1969
Mr, Donald R* Quayle
General Consultant
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
545 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Don:
When we talked in Bob Swezey’s office on November 12
we agreed that I should develop a plan for intercon¬
nection*
Here is the result of some thinking I’ve done on that
matter. I would hope the material could serve as a
base for further discussions.
One correction: In the attached station list in Cate¬
gory #2 the term optional should be deleted and se¬
condary substituted to maintain consistency with the
text.
I look forward to seeing you at the January 24 meet¬
ing Roger Penn is arranging.
The proposal on relocating the network headquarters
from Urbana to Washington, D. C. should be in the
mail early next week. The expanded Public Affairs
Bureau proposal is being developed and will be ready
in early February.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
RAM: lkl
Enclosure
cc: Richard Catalano
